result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler Scott Nye was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham July 9, 2015 - Amend JOC to transfer Defendant's Probation to Mercer County Ohio.

Defendant to report to Probation today July 6, 2015.
Court authorizes Probation to be served in the State of Ohio.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Apply bond on file and balance of bond to remain pending attorney bill.

-Defendant must register as a Sex Offender.
-NO CONTACT with juvenile males under the age of 18 years unless a relative.
-Defendant not to be employed or volunteer in a capacity where there are juvenile males under the age of 18 years.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay Supervision fees.
-Defendant to participate in Sexual Deviency Treatment, along with all recommended treatment by Agent.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with B.J.H. or his family by any means.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

timeConds.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham April 20, 2016 - Amend JOC for days credit.

***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham July 9, 2015 - Amend JOC to allow Defendant to served jail time in Mercer County Ohio.

-Condition time to commence no later than August 7, 2015.
-If unable to make arrangements by August 7, 2015, Defendant is to report to St. Croix County Jail.
-Huber for work.
-Court does NOT authorize Electronic Monitoring.
-Sentence may be served in Augiaize County Ohio without any cost to St. Croix County.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY:  Angela Raye Olson DF: Tyler Scott Nye appeared. Case called at 1:06. Court informs the DE of the maximum penalties. Court reviews PSI. There has been a risk assessment completed by Dr. Kidd. Atty. Olson believes there are no corrections in the PSI. ADA Nieskes updates the court the victim's father is present. ADA Nieskes makes sentencing recommendations. Atty. Olson makes recommendations. DE mother makes statement via phone appearance. DE makes statement. Court orders: Sentence W/H
5 years  probation with conditions
- 1 year conditional jail time
   Huber for work. Court does NOT authorize electronic monitoring. 
  Can be served in Auglaize County Ohio without any cost to St. Croix County.
- DE must register as a sex offender.
- No contact with juvenile males  under the age of 18 unless a relative 
- DE not to be employed or volunteer in a capacity where there are juvenile males under the age of 18. 
- $500 fine and costs paid from bond.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge and costs of supervision through probation.
- Balance of bond to be held pending Atty. Olsons bill. 
- DE to participate in sexual deviancy treatment, along with all recommended treatment by agent. 
-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, B.J. H.  and B.J. H. family.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- No possession/ use of body armor.

Court reserves on restitution for 30 days. 
DE to report today to probation. DE conditional jail time to commence no later than Aug. 7th.
Court authorizes probation to be served in the state of Ohio.  
If DE is not able to make arrangements by Aug. 7, 2015, DE is to report to St. Croix County Jail.
filed by Agent Terry Otradovec. eif                 w/file to SRN

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY: Angela Raye Olson DF:Tyler Scott Nye appeared. Case called at 11:07. Atty. Olson updates the court of agreement.   ADA Nieskes responds.Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to amended charge in 14CF101 3rd degree sexual assault. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended charge in 14CF101 third degree sexual assault.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: Court will NOT revoke bail. PSI to be completed by June 29, 2015. Address confirmed.

Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

**BOND AMENDED**

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  B.J.H. 6/9/1998, family or residence or any computer contact with underage males 18 and under.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

No internet usage execpt for the purposes of education and employment.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  B.J.H. 6/9/1998, family or residence or any computer contact with underage males 18 and under.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
